# `:global` doesn't work with CSS nesting

### Vue version

@d637bd6

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://play.vuejs.org/#

### Steps to reproduce

In the minimal reproduction, open the Playground's compiled CSS tab.

### What is expected?

```css
body {
  background-color: blue;
h1[data-v-7ba5bd90] {
    background-color: purple;
}
}
```

### What is actually happening?

```css
body {
&[data-v-7ba5bd90] {
  background-color: blue;
}
h1[data-v-7ba5bd90] {
    background-color: purple;
}
}
```

### System Info

_No response_

### Any additional comments?

Remove the nested `h1` selector inside `:global(body)`, and then the body's background becomes blue as expected.
